Activity : Build Your Own Maze Game

Ninja Instructions | Mentor Notes

Introduction

In this activity you will create a basic maze game.

Duration

15-30 minutes

Instructions

  1. Open up a new program area in Scratch or begin by remixing our Maze Starter program.
  2. If you are creating this program completely on your own:
    • Go into the Stage and create a backdrop that looks something like a maze. It should have a single color background and a single color of walls like:
    • Add a sprite for a ball that will be the object you move through the maze. Make sure it isn't too big or it CAN'T get through the maze.
    • Add a sprite for the goal position a the end of the maze.
    • Put them all together so you have a simple maze game showing.
  3. If you are using our sample starter code, take a look at what we have for these features.
  4. Add the following code to the ball so that it knows to start the game in it's starting location when the green flag is pressed.

    Note, if you made your own maze you will need to adjust this code to look for the color of your walls.

Great! Now you have a basic maze game. Let's play around with changes.

  • What would you need to do to modify the code to have the ball look for the goal rather than having the goal look for the ball?
  • Add multiple levels to your game by creating additional stage backdrops. How can you have the program start with level one and then advance to additional levels?
  • Change the game so that touching the walls sends you back to the beginning of the level.
  • Make a variable block to keep score.
  • Experiment with the timer blocks to add an extra level of challenge to the maze.

Things to think about when you are done

  • What was challenging about designing this game?
  • What feature are you most proud of?
